page.title: 09BRITISH GYPSUM MAY 1985
page.content: Leicestershire County Council gave approval (by one vote) to British Gypsum's plan for a{mine and factory at Barrow upon Soar. It is thought it will create five hundred and sixty new jobs. The scheme will take up one hundred and thirty three acres and is the second largest project plan Leicester County Council have dealt with. The biggest was their approval of the plan to mine coal in the Vale of Belvoir. The County Council Conservatives were against the plan. The Chairperson of the Environment Committee said that it would attract more traffic to the area and on environmental reasons should be rejected. The Alliance and Labour joined forces to pass the plan. The plan has now been sent to the Environment Secretary for his approval. {JULIAN HILLS
